required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Flexible urétéroscopy Versus Extracorporeal Shockwave Lithotripsy in Renal Calculi
clinical_study.official_title: Flexible urétéroscopy Versus Extracorporeal Shockwave Lithotripsy in 5 to 20 mm Renal Calculi, Efficacity Prospective Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Flexible ureteroscopy is a recent procedure to treat renal stone. Extracorporeal shockwave lithotripsy was the gold standard treatment for calculi between 5 and 20 mm. In literature, the two procedures are available to treat these stones with a good stone free rate. There is no prospective randomized study comparing these two treatments. Our study will define with a good level of evidence which technique is the best with regard to the stone free rate, secondary procedure rate and adverse effect.

primary_outcome.description: Rate of stone free patient or patient with residual fragment ≤ 3 mm, 3 months after the treatment evaluated, will be compare. This outcome is measured with a tomodensitometry and compares with pre treatment exams.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stone free rate in weight's sub group
secondary_outcome.description: Each arm wil be divise in 3 sub group based on body mass index (20 to 25, 25 to 30, 30 to 35). We'll compare rate of efficacity in each sub group

secondary_outcome.measure: Stone free rate in sub group depending on stone diameters
secondary_outcome.description: Each arm wil be divise in 3 sub group based on calculi diameter (5 to 10mm, 10 to 15 and 15 to 20). We'll compare rate of efficacity in each sub group
In each arm will be evaluate rate of secondary procedure needed to have the best stone free rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Serious and non serious adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: In each arm will be evaluate rate of adverse event, type, severity.

arm_group.description: intra renal retrograde surgery with or without laser and stone extraction

intervention.description: Flexible ureteroscopy will be use for 120 min max to treat renal stone. Laser, access sheath, baskets can be use to perform the technique.
The lithotriptor is use with 1,1 Hz frequency and stop when patient get 1000 joules of energy or if there is a problem with tolerance of this treatment or if stone is broken

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with 5 to 20 mm renal stone
- Age ≥ 18 years old
- Patient agreement signed
- BMI < 35
- Contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Severe musculoskeletal deformities
- Renal artery or aorta aneurysm
- Pacemaker
- Anesthesia contra indication
- Psychiatric trouble or law protection
